Otho and Vitellius were the subject of alternate praise and calumny; but praise was soon exhausted, and forabuse each party found abundant materials. XXII. At the return of day, the city and the country round displayed a scene of warlike preparation: the walls and ramparts were covered with Othonian sol- diers, and the fields glittered with the blaze of hostile arms. The legions in close array advanced to the assault, and the auxiliaries in separate divisions.
